intro: Brachyscome riparia, commonly known as the river daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, which bloom in spring and summer. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a dense rosette near the ground. Brachyscome riparia is well adapted to seasonal flooding and is an important component of riparian ecosystems.
